result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Status Report dated October 31, 2022 - received

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alejandro Rodriguez Lafrenier in court.  Attorney Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Also present, Attorney Frederick Klimetz, appearing as a friend of the court.

Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.

Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Frederick Klimetz to represent defendant at the rate of $125 per hour;  Attorney Klimetz present in court and accepted the appointment. 

Court did not rule as to whether defendant to repay the County.
Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 28.  Order Appointing Counsel to be forwarded to the Court for Judge's signature.

Defendant is not to have any contact with A.W. and G.W.H. along with previously issued no contact order.

Defendant Alejandro Rodriguez Lafrenier in court.  Attorney Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel.  No attorney has been appointed yet. Case is adjourned to 10-21-22 at 9:00 am for status of counsel.  Clerk will notify SPD of the next court date.  If no attorney is appointed by the next court date, Court will appoint an attorney. State is requesting the Court modify the no contact order that the defendant may not have any contact with A.W. and G.W.H.

Defendant Alejandro Rodriguez Lafrenier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for Alejandro Rodriguez Lafrenier.  Attorney Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin.
Statements to the Court by defense counsel as to breakdown in communication; defendant is requesting withdrawal.
Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding the request for withdrawal of counsel, responsibilities of counsel and the likelihood of significant delay in resolving the case.
Defendant renews his request for other counsel.
Court grants motion to withdraw and orders jury trial and demand for speedy trial vacated.
Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 28.

Public Defender's office notified via electronic mail as to the next court date.

Defendant Alejandro Rodriguez Lafrenier in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties before the Court for scheduling.  Defense has received discovery but advised the court there is a need to review transcripts from co-defendants trial.  Bail issue was discussed, the Court advised defendant of the seriousness of following all conditions of bail.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial.   Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order filed.   All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  mn  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.6.22, Filed.

Defendant Alejandro Rodriguez Lafrenier in court by video with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones who appears in person.  Michael Lonski appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective V. Lopez. Stipulation to the identification of the defendant agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Alejandro Rodriguez Lafrenier appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
